definitions: A piece of armour carried on the arm to protect the body from blows or missiles.
A person or thing providing protection.
A badge or emblem resembling a shield, typically bearing a coat of arms.
A large, ancient area of the Earth's crust that is tectonically stable and has been eroded to a low relief.
examples: He raised his shield to block the blow.
The trees provided a shield from the wind.
A heat shield protected the spacecraft.
The family crest was on the shield.
The Canadian Shield is rich in minerals.
